707082f-b.text:
Times Plaza, converging point of Atlantic, Flatbush, and Fourth Avenues, showing the B. M. T. elevated on Flatbush Avenue and the I. R. T. subway entrance on Atlantic Avenue. This area is also a terminal for street car lines
and buses.
June 15, 1940
Views 1,2,3
P. L. Sperr
707082f-b.folder: Atlantic Ave. & Flatbush Ave., Brooklyn, NY

704189f-a.text:
Flatbush Ave., east side, from and including Atlantic Ave., to, but not including Hanson Place. A view of the Long Island Railroad Station is at the left, and the Brooklyn Manhattan Transit Company Structure,at the right.
About 1916.
Ewing Galloway.
704189f-a.folder: Flatbush Avenue & Atlantic Avenue, Brooklyn, NY

703035f-a.text:
Atlantic Ave., north side, at and adjoinin the east side of Flatbush Ave. Also seen is Flatbush Ave., east side, from and including Atlantic Ave., to, but not including Hanson Place.

May 11, 1929

P.L. Sperr
703035f-a.folder: Atlantic Avenue & Flatbush Avenue, Brooklyn, NY

703036f-a.text:
Atlantic Ave., north side, stand west from the intersection of Atlantic and Flatbush Aves. Also seen is Flatbush Ave., west side, and north from the intersection of Atlantic and Flatbush Aves.

May 11, 1929

P.L.Sperr.
703036f-a.folder: Atlantic Avenue & Flatbush Avenue, Brooklyn, NY

704194f-a.text:
Flatbush Avenue, east side, between Atlantic Avenue and Pacific Street, showing the entrance to the B. M. T. subway station. Shown, too, are rears of tenements fronting on Atlantic Avenue and bearing numbers 608 to 616.
May 17, 1940
P. L. Sperr
